snippet: The Republic of South Sudan is not even five years old, but already 50,000 people have been killed in an ethnically driven civil war.
abstract: Civil war in Republic of South Sudan is technically over, with signed agreement calling for cessation of hostilities, but most of tens of thousands of country's displaced say they do not feel safe and hold out little hope for prolonged peace; violence continues to plagues young country, which lost some 50,000 people in ethnically driven civil war since its declaration of independence only five years ago.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: The Republic of South Sudan is not even five years old, but already 50,000 people have been killed in an ethnically driven civil war.

headline.main: In South Sudan, City of Hope Is Now City of Fear
headline.print_headline: City of Hope in South Sudan Is Now One of Fear

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
